description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**General English II - Upper-Intermediate - Spring 2020**

**Objectives**: This course is designed to support college freshmen’s in their use of English language in academic context and to **improve their output proficiency****.** This semester the class concentrates on **build****ing** **students’ proficiency** **in** **speaking and writing** through activities that integrate the four language skills. Therefore, the main objectives of this class will be to develop students’ **(1)** fluency in expressing ideas in oral and written forms in English, **(2)** English presentation skills, and **(3)** autonomous learning skills. In order to do so, there is a **five-pronged approach** to the course:

**1)** Firstly, **the course textbook** emphasizes vocabulary learning and building in order to provide students the structure and tools to acquire new words. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve reading proficiency and develop practical critical thinking.

**2)** Secondly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake one major **task-based presentation project (ppt)**, in which task groups, of no more than 3 students per group, are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are **of serious interest to themselves**, and then **present their work** to the class.

**3) Thirdly,** students are expected to read extensively to improve your English reading especially **Lexile books.** There will be a **Lexile test** in both semesters to assess any improvement.

**4) Fourthly,** students will need to do at least **15 hours of autonomous learning** in total this semester (an hour a week), which must be proven for grading.

**5) Fifth of all**, there will be a **writing workshop** after which students will be asked to write **two reviews and a short critical essay** based on class work, while there will also be four **Chapter Reviews** to quiz student comprehension.

**6)** Due to the **coronavirus outbreak**, two classes have to be made up. For one class, the **movie class will be cancelled** and replaced by a **movie review homework assignment** on a movie of your choice. For the second class, you are encouraged to **make an appointment** with me during my office hours for some **English practice.**

**N.B: All elements to the course will be evaluated and assessed**.  

**Textbook:** Daise, D., Norloff, C., & Carne, P. (2015) Q: Skills for Success: Reading and Writing, 4. New York: Oxford University Press. **(Second Edition!)**

**Textbook Online Practice:** [www.iQQonlinePractice.com](http://www.iqqonlinepractice.com/)

**Materials:** A **Notebook** for taking notes on new vocabulary, phrases, grammar, task project, homework, autonomous work and critical thinking assignments.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Eight Commandments!**

**1.    Punctual attendance** is essential. Talk to or email me if you can’t attend class or are late for class.

**2.**    This is a **Flip Class**. Homework must be done for the class to work properly. This includes reviewing and previewing class chapters.

**3.**    Actively **participate in class discussions**.

**4.**    You need to **submit work several times** during the semester. Task assignments, homework, and essays **must be done and be on time**.

**5.**    Smartphones, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.

**6.    No eating** during class, but drinks are allowed.

**7.    English Practice**: Students should practice their English every chance they get, e.g. **Self-Access Room** (Main campus 樸101), **Workshops** (Main campus 樸102), the **NTNU Competitions** and/or **iQOnlinePractice**. You are expected to do at least **15 hours** in total this semester. Alternatively, you can **record autonomous work in your notebooks for grading.**

**8.    Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework or assignments on time. 

**Grading Policy: The Business!**

Final grades are based and assessed on performance in the following:

**1)** Attendance and Participation: 10%

**2)** Chapter Reviews: 10%

**3)** Presentation Task Project: 20%

**4)** Book/movie reviews & critical essay: 15%

**5)** Self-access classroom/online learning/auto-learning: 15%

**6)** Lexile Reading Test 10%

**7)** Final Exam: 20%
